meta_description: Connect to Local History at the Tri-Cities Historical Museum. The Tri-Cities Historical Museum (TCHM) invites visitors to travel through time into the local history of Northwest Ottawa County, which includes the communities of Ferrysburg, Grand Haven, and Spring Lake: the "Tri-Cities." With local artifacts, the Museum creates displays and offers education programs that embody our mission of creating connections to Tri-Cities history. Explore with us!

admission_text:
## Free Admission

Admission to the Tri-Cities Historical Museum is free, however, we greatly appreciate donations!

The Tri-Cities Historical Museum relies on the generosity of area taxpayers, who provide about 60% of our operating funds through millage assessments. These funds allow us to offer free admission for our residents and visitors. We make up the remainder of our funding through grants, investments, memberships, and donations. If you visited the Museum and enjoyed your visit, please consider a donation. Any amount supports our mission and provides a quality experience for all who walk through our doors.

collections_text:
### Events

Experience the moments that shaped the Tri-Cities with immersive experiences that bring you up close and personal with local history.

[See All Events ](https://www.tri-citiesmuseum.org/events)

### Exhibitions

Tri-Cities Historical Museum offers exhibits for the entire family to enjoy which tell the stories of Native Americans, early pioneers, lumberjacks, French voyageurs, the Victorian Era, and more!

[See All Exhibitions ](https://www.tri-citiesmuseum.org/exhibits)

### Education

TCHM's programs creatively engage the communityâ€“ from kids, to youth, to senior citizens- in understanding, engaging with, and using local history. 

[See All Programs ](https://www.tri-citiesmuseum.org/programs)

### Collections

Explore the collected art, images, documents and objects that represent the history of the Tri-Cities. We steward these local artifacts for the generations to come.

[See the Collection ](https://www.tri-citiesmuseum.org/collections)
